intro: Chrysanthemum coronarium var. coronatum, commonly known as the common chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern and eastern Asia and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The species is also known for its adaptability and ability to naturalize in various environments.
